content.description: Another friction climb that like the rest, low crux and eases up higher.
content.location: The 2nd from the left of the bolted routes.

content.description: One of the easier lines to set up a TR for the other slab climbs. The only trad route on the wall. Dihedral stemming leads to crumbly but juggy rock right before entering the crack. The crack starts with bad flaring jams but gets better as you go up.
content.protection: Gear, can be a little difficult to protect.  Chain anchors.
content.location: Climb the crack/corner left of Moonraker.  The left most climb on the wall.

content.description: Crux is at the first bolt, the climbing eases as you move up the face.  Very thin and delicate friction moves.
content.protection: Bolts, and Chain Anchors.  I might suggest setting a ground anchor for your belayer.  A fall before the first bolt might send both of you tumbling down the steep slab.
content.location: The leftmost bolted slab route on the wall.

content.protection: LARGE cams. I’d recommend 1 BD6, 2 blue big bros and 2 BD7s or some combination of BB and BD7/Merlin/VG. BD6 is not a safe way to complete this without the help of BBs.
content.location: A very direct approach to this line can be made from line of sight. Stand south of Quarantine Daze or the meadow before Elk Slabs and Post Oak Creek. Look up to the NE and you should see Houston. If you go just north of the thick brush that makes elk slabs approach so fun you should enter a slot which runs uphill and nearly due north. Follow this up the path of least resistance and you should arrive quite near Houston and the topout of Moonrock Wall. We approached from the top after GE and had to take multiple tunnels and chimneys to get down to Houston. This may save you some time and headache. I guess we had fun though not efficient.

content.description: Shares starting bolts with Apollo, but climbs the easier terrain to the right of Apollo.
content.location: 4th from the left, shares start with Apollo.

content.description: Razor thin friction climbing.  This is the best line on the entire wall.
content.location: 3rd route from the Left.  Shares start with Fear of the Left.

content.description: Most of the routes on this wall are difficult slab climbs.
